item.title: Emoji Flags
item.description: Sometimes there’s the need to fly a flag in your project. You probably know the ISO code, more specifically the ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code, a.k.a two-letter code. For Austria this would be AT. Now when thinking about converting these codes into emoji flags, a lookup table comes to mind. But instead of jumping straight into implementing the table it’s time to take a closer look at the Unicode Standard. The clever people that added the flag emojis to the Unicode character set invented a system of specifying the flags that makes an algorithmic conversion without lookup tables quite easy.
